question: What is the main difference between AC and DC?
options: AC changes direction, DC flows in one direction
AC flows in one direction, DC changes direction
DC flows in a loop, AC does not
answer: AC changes direction, DC flows in one direction

question: How many terminals does a typical Light Dependent Resistor have?
Which of the following best describes the difference between block-level and textual programming?
options: Block-level programming uses real wires, while textual programming does not
Block-level programming uses graphical blocks to represent code, while textual Programming uses written code or text
Textual programming is used only for gaming, while block-level is used for mobile apps
Textual programming cannot be used to create real applications
answer: Block-level programming uses graphical blocks to represent code, while textual Programming uses written code or text

Which of the following best explains the role of coding and robotics in modern careers?
options: They are only used in laboratories
They are only for scientists and engineers
They can be applied in many fields like agriculture, medicine, business, and education
They are too difficult for non-science students
answer: They can be applied in many fields like agriculture, medicine, business, and education

question: Why is it good to start learning coding and robotics at a young age?
options: It builds early problem-solving and creativity skills
It helps students become perfect gamers
It prevents students from using phones
It is easier to understand only when you're older
answer: It builds early problem-solving and creativity skills

question: Which statement is TRUE about learning coding and robotics?
options: It must be done only after graduating from school
It can help students in both science and non-science professions solve problems
It is useful only for building video games
It is a waste of time for non-science students
answer: It can help students in both science and non-science professions solve problems

options: To protect the LED from too much current
